description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国开国少将，曾任中国人民解放军第二炮兵部队政治委员、北京卫戍区司令员、武汉军区政治委员等职务。
description.en: Founding major general of the People's Republic of China, served as Political Commissar of the PLA Second Artillery Corps, Commander of the Beijing Garrison, and Political Commissar of the Wuhan Military Region.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国江西省下的一个县，是吴烈的出生地。
description.en: A county under Jiangxi Province, Republic of China, and the birthplace of Wu Lie.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国首都，吴烈于此地逝世。
description.en: The capital of the People's Republic of China, where Wu Lie passed away.

description.zh-cn: 中国的执政党，吴烈是其党员。
description.en: The ruling party of China, of which Wu Lie was a member.

nodes.id: 中国人民抗日军政大学

zh-cn: 中国人民抗日军政大学

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党在抗日战争时期创办的军事政治学校，吴烈曾在此学习。
description.en: A military and political school established by the Communist Party of China during the Second Sino-Japanese War, where Wu Lie studied.

nodes.id: 中国人民解放军高等军事学院

zh-cn: 中国人民解放军高等军事学院

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军的高等学府，吴烈曾在此进修。
description.en: A higher education institution of the People's Liberation Army, where Wu Lie pursued advanced studies.

description.zh-cn: 开国少将吴烈的长子。
description.en: The eldest son of founding Major General Wu Lie.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国前主要领导人之一，曾领导安源路矿罢工。
description.en: A former major leader of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, who led the Anyuan Road and Mining Strike.

description.zh-cn: 1922年由刘少奇、李立三等领导的工人运动，吴烈在童工时期参与了此运动。
description.en: A workers' movement led by Liu Shaoqi, Li Lisan, and others in 1922, in which Wu Lie participated as a child laborer.

description.zh-cn: 中国工农红军的早期部队之一，吴烈于1930年加入。
description.en: One of the early units of the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army, which Wu Lie joined in 1930.

description.zh-cn: 中国工农红军的战略性转移，吴烈随中央红军参与了长征。
description.en: A strategic military retreat by the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army, in which Wu Lie participated with the Central Red Army.

description.zh-cn: 即红一方面军，是中国工农红军的主力部队之一，吴烈曾在此担任警卫并随其长征。
description.en: Also known as the First Front Army of the Red Army, one of the main forces of the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army. Wu Lie served as a guard in this unit and participated in the Long March with it.

description.zh-cn: 1945年至1949年间在中国发生的内战，吴烈在此期间指挥部队作战。
description.en: The civil war that took place in China from 1945 to 1949, during which Wu Lie commanded troops in combat.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军负责保卫首都北京的军事单位，吴烈曾担任其司令员和政治委员。
description.en: The military unit of the People's Liberation Army responsible for the defense of the capital, Beijing. Wu Lie served as its commander and political commissar.

nodes.id: 中国人民解放军第二炮兵部队

zh-cn: 中国人民解放军第二炮兵部队

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军的战略导弹部队，吴烈曾担任其政治委员。
description.en: The strategic missile force of the People's Liberation Army, where Wu Lie served as political commissar.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军曾存在的一个大军区，吴烈曾在此担任政治委员和副政委。
description.en: A former military region of the People's Liberation Army, where Wu Lie served as political commissar and deputy political commissar.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军曾存在的七大军区之一，吴烈曾兼任其副政委。
description.en: One of the former seven military regions of the People's Liberation Army, where Wu Lie concurrently served as deputy political commissar.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军少将，吴烈的前任北京卫戍区司令员。
description.en: A major general of the People's Liberation Army, Wu Lie's predecessor as commander of the Beijing Garrison.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军少将，吴烈的继任北京卫戍区司令员。
description.en: A major general of the People's Liberation Army, Wu Lie's successor as commander of the Beijing Garrison.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军中将，吴烈的继任北京卫戍区政治委员。
description.en: A lieutenant general of the People's Liberation Army, Wu Lie's successor as political commissar of the Beijing Garrison.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军中将，曾任第二炮兵部队政治委员。
description.en: A lieutenant general of the People's Liberation Army, served as the Political Commissar of the Second Artillery Corps.

description.zh-cn: 吴烈出生于江西省萍乡县。
description.en: Wu Lie was born in Pingxiang County, Jiangxi Province.

description.zh-cn: 吴时锋是吴烈的长子。
description.en: Wu Shifeng is the eldest son of Wu Lie.

description.zh-cn: 吴烈是中国共产党党员。
description.en: Wu Lie was a member of the Communist Party of China.

relationships.target: 中国人民抗日军政大学

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争爆发后，吴烈进入中国人民抗日军政大学学习。
description.en: After the outbreak of the Second Sino-Japanese War, Wu Lie studied at the Counter-Japanese Military and Political University.

relationships.target: 中国人民解放军高等军事学院

description.zh-cn: 1961年，吴烈进入高等军事学院进修。
description.en: In 1961, Wu Lie pursued advanced studies at the Higher Military Academy.

description.zh-cn: 吴烈在担任童工期间参与了安源路矿罢工。
description.en: Wu Lie participated in the Anyuan Road and Mining Strike while working as a child laborer.

description.zh-cn: 刘少奇是安源路矿罢工的领导者之一。
description.en: Liu Shaoqi was one of the leaders of the Anyuan Road and Mining Strike.

description.zh-cn: 1930年，吴烈加入中国工农红军第三军。
description.en: In 1930, Wu Lie joined the Third Army of the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army.

position.en: Guard of the Central Security Force

description.zh-cn: 吴烈曾加入红军中央保卫部队，担负红军首脑和中共中央的警卫，并随中央红军长征。
description.en: Wu Lie joined the Central Security Force of the Red Army, responsible for guarding the leaders of the Red Army and the CPC Central Committee, and participated in the Long March with the Central Red Army.

description.zh-cn: 1934年，吴烈随中央红军参加长征。
description.en: In 1934, Wu Lie participated in the Long March with the Central Red Army.

description.zh-cn: 在第二次国共内战时期，吴烈指挥其所属师参加了东北地区的多场战役。
description.en: During the Chinese Civil War, Wu Lie commanded his division in several campaigns in the Northeast region.

relationships.target: 中国人民解放军第二炮兵部队

description.zh-cn: 1968年3月至1970年3月，吴烈担任第二炮兵部队政治委员。
description.en: From March 1968 to March 1970, Wu Lie served as the Political Commissar of the Second Artillery Corps.

description.zh-cn: 1959年1月至1962年4月，吴烈担任北京卫戍区司令员。
description.en: From January 1959 to April 1962, Wu Lie served as the Commander of the Beijing Garrison.

description.zh-cn: 1976年10月至1987年10月，吴烈担任北京卫戍区政治委员。
description.en: From October 1976 to October 1987, Wu Lie served as the Political Commissar of the Beijing Garrison.

description.zh-cn: 1975年4月，吴烈担任武汉军区政治委员，随即降为副政委。
description.en: In April 1975, Wu Lie was appointed Political Commissar of the Wuhan Military Region and was subsequently demoted to Deputy Political Commissar.

description.zh-cn: 吴烈在担任北京卫戍区政治委员期间，兼任北京军区副政委。
description.en: While serving as the Political Commissar of the Beijing Garrison, Wu Lie concurrently held the position of Deputy Political Commissar of the Beijing Military Region.

description.zh-cn: 吴烈接替刘福，出任中国人民解放军北京卫戍区司令员。
description.en: Wu Lie succeeded Liu Fu as the Commander of the PLA Beijing Garrison.

description.zh-cn: 曾美接替吴烈，出任中国人民解放军北京卫戍区司令员。
description.en: Zeng Mei succeeded Wu Lie as the Commander of the PLA Beijing Garrison.

description.zh-cn: 李进民接替吴烈，出任中国人民解放军北京卫戍区政治委员。
description.en: Li Jinmin succeeded Wu Lie as the Political Commissar of the PLA Beijing Garrison.

description.zh-cn: 1968年，第二炮兵政委李天焕离职，吴烈曾短暂出任政治委员。
description.en: In 1968, after the Second Artillery Corps Political Commissar Li Tianhuan left his post, Wu Lie briefly served as the Political Commissar.
